1. To establish integrated education in a minimum of 50% of primary and secondary schools in Northern Ireland as soon as possible or within 7 years.

2. To consider and discuss in an unbiased, impartial forum Integrated Education taking place in the majority of schools in Northern Ireland. To represent the views of all the population of Northern Ireland, not only the voting population but the whole population. To respect our different religious beliefs within truly integrated schools. To consider bringing in an impartial third party to assist in the development of a shared future through integrated education in Northern Ireland. To ensure the balance of pupils,staff and governors reflects the religious makeup of Northern Ireland.
